intro: Colpodium biebersteinianum, commonly known as the small-flowered colpodium, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
